comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Tweddle's Belmore Hotel (aka the First and Last) identifies this as Circular Quay. See this 26/1/1888 Henry King Photo, which also shows stonework on the quay in progress.

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2495797591/]

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: In the upstairs room of that hotel Charles Condor painted "The Departure of the Orient' in 1888.

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] According to the Sands Directory, Mrs. Jemima Tweddle (not to be confused with this Jemima) was the licensee of the Belmore in 1888.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: I see a big bass drum and a euphonium - I wonder if they were playing the 'Floral Dance' ?
